sections.title: Making Grammar Inclusive
sections.subtitle: Factoring in a Non-Binary Voice in Perfective/Completed Action Aspectual Conjugations

body.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Factoring in a ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"value":"non-binary voice","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" in the Perfective/Completed Action (CA) aspect","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-4"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In Hindi, the Perfective or Completed Action (CA) aspect is used to convey that an actual one time action has been completed. These are equivalent to the English, “I came”, “I saw”, “I conquered”.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"To see how the perfective/CA aspect works with the ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"value":"non-binary voice ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"proposed by the ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"value":"Making Hindi Grammar Inclusive","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" project, check out the links below.
